body:
DebianPrep is a lightweight automation script designed to simplify the process of configuring new Debian-based servers. Whether you’re setting up a local virtual machine or connecting to a remote VPS, DebianPrep helps you get a clean, ready-to-code environment in minutes.

Definition: DebianPrep automates the installation of essential tools, utilities, and system configurations that are commonly needed right after deploying a fresh Debian or Ubuntu server.

🚀 Purpose

When you spin up a new server, you often repeat the same initial setup tasks: updating packages, installing common utilities, configuring firewalls, enabling SSH, and more. DebianPrep automates all these actions through a single command.

🖥️ Supported Systems

DebianPrep supports all Debian-based Linux distributions, including:

  • Ubuntu (20.04 and newer)
  • Debian (10 and newer)
  • Linux Mint
  • Pop!_OS and more

⚙️ Features

  • Automatic package updates and upgrades
  • Installs essential tools: curl, wget, git, ufw, htop
  • Sets up SSH and basic firewall rules
  • Creates a system cleanup and optimization routine
  • Fast and idempotent; safe to run multiple times

📦 Installation

To run DebianPrep, simply execute the following command after connecting to your new Debian-based server:

bash
curl -L -o debianprep https://github.com/doe-base/debianprep/releases/download/v1.0.0/debianprep
chmod +x debianprep
./debianprep

This will download the script from the official GitHub repository and execute it immediately.

🧰 What It Installs

CategoryTools
Networkingcurl, wget, net-tools, openssh-server
System Utilitieshtop, unzip, tar, ufw, git
Developmentbuild-essential, pkg-config, make

🔧 Usage

DebianPrep can be used on any fresh Debian-based system. Run it immediately after gaining SSH access:

bash
ssh user@your-server-ip
curl -L -o debianprep https://github.com/doe-base/debianprep/releases/download/v1.0.0/debianprep
chmod +x debianprep
sudo mv debianprep /usr/local/bin/
debianprep

The script handles everything automatically. Once complete, your environment will be updated and ready for use.

🧠 Behind the Scenes

DebianPrep is written in Go and structured using modular internal commands for maintainability. Each command handles a distinct setup area; such as user creation, package installation, and security configuration.

📘 License

DebianPrep is released under the MIT License. Feel free to modify and reuse it for your own setup workflows.

🔗 Reference
